message: Here is my idea. Obviously kickstarter could be used as a vehicle. Each of the hosts would do a 1.5 hour show that is divided into 18 five minute segments. The segments will be a Skype-In question from a patron/bidder. Some hosts would cost more than others and some shy hosts could double up. I think we could have Leo, Tom, Eileen, Jason, Sarah, Dick, Amber, iYaz, Becky, Lisa JERRI, Andy & Alex, Brian, Jeff & Gina, tha't's all I can think of at the moment, that is 14 shows. 14 x 18 segments is 252 segments. With an average price of $400 that could yield $100,000. Is it too much work to organize that with getting the callers qued on SkypeFacebook etc?
thought i just throw this here, i'd pay $50 - $70 for any headwear I could wear out... preferably short brimmed fedora :D
@HateBadDesign haha that sounds kind of creepy :)
I want motivational mp3s from the hosts. So if you had to say go for a run, to aren't quite up to it, you could have Tom go "You can do it! Come on! Just another corner! for 30 minutes *g*
Leo said they actually would do like a phone message or something.
Are TWiT hurting for money?  If so, one idea might be to -not- kill off popular programs like Net@Night.  That is, if advertiser money is important.
it's still there, just renamed to social hour. and - Leo + Sarah
@cmoore Its the Leo statue which is costing more than expected ;)
Auction for place in Leo's boat. That he is going to circumnavigate the world in.
@lyerla2 He'll have you swab the deck! (unless you look good lounging around in a bikini ;-)
There could be a pool for the date the first hacker takes down Comcast for their anti neutrality.
